string-array.name: guardian_connect_instructions
string-array.item: Push switch down to power on

string-array.name: audiomoth_sync_instructions
string-array.item: Mid to high volume set on phone
AudioMoth microphone close to phone speaker

string-array.name: songmeter_connect_instructions
string-array.item: After Song Meter appear, long-pressed Bluetooth button
Press until green led blinking on bluetooth
Back to the app, press connect

string-array.name: audiomoth_guideline_texts
string-array.item: Take or Choose a photo that shows the device id\npurpose is to serve as redundancy for which device is where if there were to be a metadata issue
Take or Choose a photo that shows the device placement within 1–3 meters\nhelps to find the AM if it’s in dense vegetation
Take or Choose a photo that shows the device location (tree/bush/vine) within 5–10 meters\nhelps to spot the tree/bush/vine that the AM is in
Take or Choose a photo that shows the broader location or view from the approach within 15–20 meters\nhelps to recognize the surroundings when looking for the tree/bush/vine
Take or Choose a photo that shows the place to exit the road or trail\nhelps recognize the area to leave the road or trail if it’s off trail/there’s no path

string-array.name: songmeter_guideline_texts
string-array.item: Take or Choose a photo that shows the device id\npurpose is to serve as redundancy for which device is where if there were to be a metadata issue
Take or Choose a photo that shows the device placement within 1–3 meters\nhelps to find the AM if it’s in dense vegetation
Take or Choose a photo that shows the device location (tree/bush/vine) within 5–10 meters\nhelps to spot the tree/bush/vine that the AM is in
Take or Choose a photo that shows the broader location or view from the approach within 15–20 meters\nhelps to recognize the surroundings when looking for the tree/bush/vine
Take or Choose a photo that shows the place to exit the road or trail\nhelps recognize the area to leave the road or trail if it’s off trail/there’s no path

string-array.name: sat_guardian_guideline_texts
string-array.item: This picture should show that all the antennas are in the right position and that they are securely attached.
This picture should show that the frame is securely attached to the guardian box by at least two cable ties.
This picture should show an that the panels are securely attached to the frame.
This picture should show all the solar panels are securely attached to the frame using nuts and that the panels aren’t overly shaded.
This picture should show the baseplate is flatly mounted, either horizontally on an adequately sized branch or vertically on the trunk with at least 6 to 8 screws.
This picture should show the arm (if used) angled downwards.
This picture should show a clear sky above the panels so nothing is blocking sunlight access.
This picture should show the microphone is covered with the cover and secure with a cable tie.
The swarm antenna can tolerate some canopy cover, but ideally there should be as much clear sky as possible.

The swarm antenna should be pointing towards the sky and be secured to the mount with two to three cable ties. The radials shouldn’t be touching the tree. Moreover, the antenna should be placed at least 1m from the Guardian box itself.
The GPS antenna should be installed flat on a horizontal branch with two screws. The Antenna shouldn’t be vertical or at an angle.

string-array.name: cell_guardian_guideline_texts
string-array.item: This picture should show that all the antennas are in the right position and that they are securely attached.
This picture should show that the frame is securely attached to the guardian box by at least two cable ties.
This picture should show an that the panels are securely attached to the frame.
This picture should show all the solar panels are securely attached to the frame using nuts and that the panels aren’t overly shaded.
This picture should show the base plate is flatly mounted, either horizontally on an adequately sized branch or vertically on the trunk with at least 6 to 8 screws.
This picture should show the arm (if used) angled downwards.
This picture should show a clear sky above the panels so nothing is blocking sunlight access.
This picture should show the micro is covered with the cover and secure with a cable tie.
The GSM antenna should be placed snugly in the mount secured by at least 2 cable ties. The paddle antenna should be pointing upwards towards the sky as high in the tree as possible.
